required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pericapsular Nerve Group Block for Elective Hip Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Pericapsular Nerve Group Block for Analgesia After Hip Arthroplasty: a Randomized Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: This study examine the effect of Pericapsular Nerve Group (PENG) Block on analgesia after elective hip arthroplasty. Half of participants will receive a PENG Block with local anesthetic, while the other half will receive a PENG Block with a placebo.

detailed_description.textblock:
Optimized analgesia is crucial for early mobilization after hip arthroplasty. Regional anesthesia, like fascia iliaca block or femoral nerve block, have limited indication because of motor blockade whereas local infiltrations analgesia have shown conflicting analgesic efficacy results in hip arthroplasty.
Pericapsular nerve group (PENG) block is a new regional anesthesia technique targeting specifically sensory nerve branches of the hip articulation. It has been originally described in hip fracture patients.
The aim of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of PENG block on analgesia after elective hip arthroplasty.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Injected solutions will be prepared by an anesthetist not involved in the study protocol.

primary_outcome.description: A visual analog pain scale anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 100 [100‐mm scale]) will be used to evaluate pain on first mobilization at day 0 after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Pain Score in Post-Anaesthesia Care Unit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through postoperative time during Post Anesthesia Care Unit stay at day 0
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum Pain score evaluated in Post Anesthesia Care Unit by a a visual analog pain scale anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 100 [100‐mm scale])

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Postoperative time until midnight day 0
secondary_outcome.description: Total of Piritramid, Oxycodone and Oxycodone Extended Released expressed as equivalent of morphine at day 0

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through the end of surgery until Post Anesthesia Care Unit discharge to the ward at day 0
secondary_outcome.description: Total of Piritramid use from the end of surgery until Post Anesthesia Care Unit discharge to the ward

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Postoperative time during Post Anesthesia Care Unit stay at day 0
secondary_outcome.description: Total of Oxycodone and Oxycodone Extended Released expressed as equivalent of morphine at day 1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Postoperative time until midnight day 2
secondary_outcome.description: Total of Oxycodone and Oxycodone Extended Released expressed as equivalent of morphine at day 2

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: A visual analog pain scale anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 100 [100‐mm scale]) will be used to evaluate pain at rest 2h after surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: A visual analog pain scale anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 100 [100‐mm scale]) will be used to evaluate pain on mobilization 2h after surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: A visual analog pain scale anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 100 [100‐mm scale]) will be used to evaluate pain at rest 4h after surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: A visual analog pain scale anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 100 [100‐mm scale]) will be used to evaluate pain on mobilization 4h after surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: A visual analog pain scale anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 100 [100‐mm scale]) will be used to evaluate pain at rest 6h after surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: A visual analog pain scale anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 100 [100‐mm scale]) will be used to evaluate pain on mobilization 6h after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Score at Rest Day 1 AM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 in the morning after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: A visual analog pain scale anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 100 [100‐mm scale]) will be used to evaluate pain at rest in the morning of day 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Score on mobilization Day 1 AM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 in the morning after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: A visual analog pain scale anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 100 [100‐mm scale]) will be used to evaluate pain on mobilization in the morning of day 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Score at Rest Day 1 PM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 in the afternoon after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: A visual analog pain scale anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 100 [100‐mm scale]) will be used to evaluate pain at rest in the afternoon of day 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Score on mobilization Day 1 PM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 in the afternoon after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: A visual analog pain scale anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 100 [100‐mm scale]) will be used to evaluate pain on mobilization in the afternoon of day 1

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Score at Rest Day 2 AM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 2 in the morning after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: A visual analog pain scale anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 100 [100‐mm scale]) will be used to evaluate pain at rest in the morning of day 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Score on mobilization Day 2 AM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 2 in the morning after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: A visual analog pain scale anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 100 [100‐mm scale]) will be used to evaluate pain on mobilization in the morning of day 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Score at Rest Day 2 PM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 2 in the afternoon after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: A visual analog pain scale anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 100 [100‐mm scale]) will be used to evaluate pain at rest in the afternoon of day 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Score on mobilization Day 2 PM
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 2 in the afternoon after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: A visual analog pain scale anchored by "no pain" (score of 0) and "pain as bad as it could be" or "worst imaginable pain" (score of 100 [100‐mm scale]) will be used to evaluate pain on mobilization in the afternoon of day 2

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Postoperative time until midnight day 0
secondary_outcome.description: Success rate of patients mobilized the day of surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Intraoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: Total infused remifentanil dose per kg body weight per minute of total operative time

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through postoperative time during Post Anesthesia Care Unit stay at day 0
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of quadriceps motricity by Neal test which consist in supporting the knee under the popliteal fossa and asking the patient to extend the knee against resistance.

other_outcome.description: Patient satisfaction for the first 24h after surgery recorded with a scale from 0 (unsatisfied) to 10 (extremely satisfied).

other_outcome.time_frame: During hospital stay, up to 1 week
other_outcome.description: Calculated as the number of days between the hospital admission and discharge dates.

other_outcome.time_frame: Postoperative time during Post Anesthesia Care Unit stay at day 0
other_outcome.description: Time from the arrival in Post Anesthesia Care Unit until discharge to the ward
The incidence and severity of postoperative nausea (none=0, mild=1, moderate=2, severe=3), episodes of vomiting, and need for rescue antiemetics was also documented.

arm_group.description: PENG block with 20 ml of a mixture of 1% Lidocaine with 0,5% Ropivacaine and 1/400.000 Epinephrine
PENG block with 20 ml of 0,9% saline

intervention.description: After induction of general anesthesia, PENG block with 20 ml of a mixture of 1% Lidocaine with 0,5% Ropivacaine and 1/400.000 Epinephrine will be performed as described by Giron-Arongo et al with a high frequency linear probe. A 22G 80 mm needle (SonoPlex, Pajunk ) will be used.

After induction of general anesthesia, PENG block with 20 ml of 0,9% saline will be performed as described by Giron-Arongo et al with a high frequency linear probe. A 22G 80 mm needle (SonoPlex, Pajunk ) will be used.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Elective total hip arthroplasty
- General anesthesia
- Enhanced Recovery Program
Exclusion Criteria:
- American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) Score > 2
- Drug allergy
- Significant psychiatric disturbances
- Preoperative opioid use
- Contraindication to acetaminophen, celecoxib, methylprednisolone or tranexamic acid
- Body Mass Index > 40 kg/m²

reference.citation: Girón-Arango L, Peng PWH, Chin KJ, Brull R, Perlas A. Pericapsular Nerve Group (PENG) Block for Hip Fracture. Reg Anesth Pain Med. 2018 Nov;43(8):859-863. doi: 10.1097/AAP.0000000000000847.
